original: Kvarnbäck, John Sigge, sekreterare, Linköping, f. 30/12/01 i Mjölby. G. 36 m. Els-Marie Blomqwist. Barn: Ulla f. 39, Tor 41, Gunnar 43, Bengt 45. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 21, agronom-ex. v. Alnarps lantbr:inst. 25. E. o. lär. v. Önnestads lantmannask. 25-27, ord. lär. v. Törsta dito 27-30, anst. h. Jämti. läns hush:sällsk. 29-30, ord. lär. v. Berga lantbr:sk. 31-33, konsulent h. Avelsfören. f. sv. röd o. vit boiskap 33-35, husdjurskonsulent h. östergötl. läns hush:sällsk. 35-43, dess sekr. sed. 43. Ordf. i öistergötl. läns ungd :nd 43, i styr. f. hush :sällskapets veteri-näravd. 44, led. av jordbrukets fören:-nd ,samt torrläggn :ndn i östergötl. län 43 resp. 45, Linköp. stads kristidsnd 44, styr. f. Avelsfören. f. sv. röd o. vit boskap 39-45, Sv. husdjurskonsu-lentfören. 41-44, Östergötl. lantmannask., centrala kontrollfören. o. fröod-larefören. samt Adelsnäs trädgårdssk., frökontrollanst. i Linköp. o. Linköp. stads offentl. slakthus 43. Resor t. Danm., TysM. o. Holl. 28, Danm. 32, Tyskl. o. Schweiz 39. Skr.: Nötkreaturs-, får- o. svinskötsel (i J. Kaldén o. S. Kvarnbäck: Husdjursskötseln i östra distr. 42).
translated: Kvarnbäck, John Sigge, secretary, Linköping, b. 30/12/01 in Mjölby. Married in 1936 to Els-Marie Blomqwist. Children: Ulla b. 1939, Tor b. 1941, Gunnar b. 1943, Bengt b. 1945. — High school graduate in Linköping in 1921, agronomy graduate from Alnarps Agricultural Institute in 1925. Temporary teacher at Önnestad Agricultural School 1925-1927, regular teacher at Törsta Agricultural School 1927-1930, employed at Jämti County Agricultural Society 1929-1930, regular teacher at Berga Agricultural School 1931-1933, consultant for the Swedish Red and White Cattle Breeders' Association 1933-1935, livestock consultant at Östergötland County Agricultural Society 1935-1943, secretary since 1943. Chairman of Östergötland County Youth Association in 1943, board member of the Veterinary Department of the Agricultural Society in 1944, member of the Agriculture Association and the Drainage Board in Östergötland County in 1943 and 1945, member of Linköping City Emergency Board in 1944, board member of the Swedish Red and White Cattle Breeders' Association from 1939-1945, member of the Swedish Livestock Consultant Association from 1941-1944, member of Östergötland Agricultural Society, Central Control Association, Seed Growers Association, and Adelsnäs Horticultural School, Seed Test Station in Linköping, and Linköping City Public Slaughterhouse in 1943. Travels to Denmark, Germany, and the Netherlands in 1928, Denmark in 1932, Germany and Switzerland in 1939. Writings include "Livestock Management for Cattle, Sheep, and Pigs" (in collaboration with J. Kaldén: Livestock Management in the Eastern District in 1942).
